title: Classic Lingerie & Foundations
description: From girdles to pantyhose, test your knowledge of the undergarments that shaped mid-century fashion!

questions.question: What restrictive undergarment, worn by nearly every woman in the 1950s, was designed to flatten the stomach and smooth the hips?
questions.explanation: The girdle was considered an essential undergarment in the 1950s. Nearly every woman wore one, and going without was considered improper.

questions.question: What type of bra, designed to create a dramatic pointed shape, was the standard style in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: The bullet bra (or torpedo bra) created the distinctive pointed bust silhouette of the 1950s, as seen on stars like Marilyn Monroe and Jane Russell.

questions.question: What revolutionary hosiery product, introduced by Glen Raven Mills in 1959, combined panties and stockings into one garment?
questions.explanation: Pantyhose were introduced in 1959 and became widely popular in the 1960s, gradually replacing stockings and garter belts as the standard leg covering.

questions.question: What accessory was used to hold up women's stockings before pantyhose became popular?
questions.explanation: Garter belts, worn around the waist with attached clips to hold up stockings, were the standard method of keeping stockings up before pantyhose.

questions.question: What full-length undergarment, essentially a dress worn under clothing, was standard in women's wardrobes through the 1960s?
questions.explanation: The full slip, a silky garment worn under dresses and skirts, was an essential part of every woman's wardrobe through the 1960s, preventing see-through clothing.

questions.question: What DuPont synthetic fabric revolutionized stockings when it was introduced in 1939?
questions.explanation: Nylon stockings, introduced by DuPont in 1939, were a sensation. When they first went on sale in 1940, four million pairs sold in just four days.

questions.question: What happened to nylon stockings during World War II that created a massive shortage?
options: Nylon was diverted for military use (parachutes)
questions.explanation: During WWII, nylon production was diverted to making parachutes and other military supplies, creating severe shortages and even 'nylon riots' when stockings became available.

questions.question: What iconic lingerie brand, known for its catalog, was founded in 1977 and became a cultural phenomenon in the 1980s?
questions.explanation: Victoria's Secret, founded by Roy Raymond in 1977, transformed lingerie shopping from embarrassing to glamorous and became a 1980s cultural phenomenon.

questions.question: Which lingerie company ran the famous 'I dreamed I went _____ in my Maidenform bra' advertising campaign?
questions.explanation: Maidenform's 'I Dreamed' campaign, running from 1949 to 1969, featured women in bras doing adventurous things, becoming one of the longest-running ad campaigns.

questions.question: What Playtex product promised women comfort while still providing support, marketed as 'the living bra'?
questions.explanation: The Playtex Living Bra, made of stretch fabric, was marketed as comfortable enough for active lifestyles while still providing shaping support.

questions.question: What Playtex bra was famous for its tagline 'lifts and separates'?
questions.explanation: Playtex Cross Your Heart bra used the famous 'lifts and separates' tagline in TV commercials that became a well-known pop culture reference.

questions.question: What feminine protest action at the 1968 Miss America Pageant became a symbol of the women's liberation movement?
options: Throwing bras and girdles in a freedom trash can
questions.explanation: Feminist protesters at the 1968 Miss America Pageant threw bras, girdles, and other 'instruments of female torture' into a freedom trash can on the Atlantic City boardwalk.

questions.question: What was a 'merry widow,' popular in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: The merry widow was a strapless foundation garment combining a long-line bra with a waist-cinching corset, popular for wearing under formal gowns in the 1950s.

questions.question: What fabric innovation made 1960s undergarments more comfortable and less rigid than their 1950s counterparts?
questions.explanation: The introduction of Lycra (spandex) in the 1960s revolutionized foundation garments, replacing rigid boning and rubber with comfortable stretch fabrics.

questions.question: What risque lingerie store, founded in 1947 in Hollywood, was known for its glamorous and provocative designs?
questions.explanation: Frederick's of Hollywood, founded by Frederick Mellinger in 1947, was known for its provocative lingerie and is credited with popularizing the push-up bra.
